yaml.title: Ana-Maria Ciuhu
yaml.subtitle: Researcher (National Institute of Statistics) · Researcher (Institute for National Economy) · Lecturer (ASE, 2024–2025)

markdown.markdown:
::: {.badges} [ORCID: 0000-0002-2195-8985](https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2195-8985){.badge} [WOS: M-9130-2018](https://www.webofscience.com/wos/author/record/M-9130-2018){.badge} [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=8o4WmLQAAAAJ){.badge} ::: ::: {.callout-note} **Summary** Researcher in official statistics and labour economics, with experience in sampling and weighting, production of social statistics, methodological development, poverty and social inclusion indicators, international migration, and human capital formation. Active in national and EU projects, with teaching experience (R for official statistics) and involvement in organizing the *Use of R in Official Statistics (uRos)* international conference. :::
Download CV (PDF)
--- - Location: Bucharest, Romania - Areas: social statistics, sampling & weighting, sampling errors, poverty/social inclusion indicators, demography, international migration, labour economics, human capital, R & LaTeX, training. - Affiliations: National Institute of Statistics (INS); Institute for National Economy – Romanian Academy; Bucharest University of Economic Studies (ASE). --- ## Professional Experience {#experience}
**Researcher**, *National Institute of Statistics (INS)* — Bucharest, Romania **Period:** 17 Oct 2011 – present **Unit:** Household surveys sampling unit (since 07 Feb 2013) **Key responsibilities:** sampling frame construction, survey design, weighting and error computation, organization of social surveys, methodological development for social inclusion, poverty and inclusion indicators, questionnaire design, participation in national/EU projects, organization of the *Use of R in Official Statistics (uRos)* conference (13 editions), technical training in R, activities for the 2021 Population and Housing Census.
**Senior Researcher**, *Institute for National Economy, Romanian Academy* — Bucharest, Romania **Period:** 01 Mar 2014 – present **Topics:** labour market dynamics, productivity, human capital formation, demographic transitions, scientific publishing, participation in projects and conferences.
**Lecturer (adjunct)**, *ASE – Department of Cybernetics, Statistics and Economic Informatics* — Bucharest, Romania **Period:** 01 Oct 2024 – 28 Feb 2025 **Activities:** “European Statistical System” seminars with R applications for official statistics (EMOS master programme); exercises and case studies using Eurostat/INS data; R data import, processing and analysis; use of dedicated R packages.
**Demography & Censuses expertise (earlier role)**, *INS – Demography and Censuses Directorate* **Period:** 17 Oct 2011 – 01 Jul 2013 **Focus:** methodologies for international migration estimation (EU/UN regulations review, model testing); operations for the 2011 Census (final tables validation, derived indicators).
--- ## Education {#education}
**Postdoctoral studies in Economics** — Romanian Academy **Period:** 02 Aug 2021 – 30 Sep 2023 · EQF 8 **Topic:** *Human capital – labour market and the challenges of digitalization*.
**PhD in Economics** — Romanian Academy **Period:** 01 Nov 2015 – 30 Oct 2019 **Topic:** *Human capital – potential and reality* (labour economics).
**Master in Economics & Communication** — ASE, Faculty of Economics **Period:** 2009 – 2011 **Representative topics:** economic discourse, communication models; dissertation: *African countries’ position in the global economy. Case: the Millennium Development Goals for Africa*.
**BSc in Economics** — ASE, Faculty of Economics **Period:** 2006 – 2009 **Topics:** micro/macro‑economics, corporate communication, public relations; dissertation: *The role of brands in the new economy. Case study: Apple*.
--- ## Skills {#skills} - sampling design, weighting, statistical quality control - data science: data collection, processing, analysis, visualization; dataset creation - R (advanced), LaTeX (very good), open‑source software - poverty/inclusion indicators, social statistics, demography and migration - questionnaire design, technical training, international event organization - written/oral communication, teamwork, planning --- ## Languages {#languages} - **Romanian** — native - **English** — C2 (comprehension), C1 (production / interaction / writing) - **Spanish** — B1/B2 (comprehension), A2 (production / interaction), B1 (writing) - **French** — B1 (comprehension), A2 (production / interaction), A1 (writing) --- ## Useful Links {#links} - **INS** — - **ORCID** — 0000‑0002‑2195‑8985 - **WOS ResearcherID** — M‑9130‑2018 - **Google Scholar** — public profile --- ## Contact {#contact} | | | |:-------------|:----------------------------------| | **E‑mail** | anamaria.ciuhu@insse.ro | | **Location** | Bucharest, Romania |
